data.title: Boulder County Campus in Longmont
data.text:
Begin Your Journey

Located in southwest Longmont, FRCC's Boulder County Campus offers a close-knit community of about 4,100 students. We also provide first-rate career and technical training programs, and many students start here and transfer to four-year universities. The top transfer destinations for our Boulder County students are the University of Colorado-Boulder and the Metropolitan State University of Denver.

Because we are the smallest of the three campuses, we see ourselves as a family. The faculty and advisors at Boulder County will walk you through your entire educational journey hereâ€”from registering for classes to facilitating the transfer process.

east Explore Our Programs

east Visit Us

east Request Info

Center for Integrated Manufacturing

Prepare for a rewarding career in manufacturing through the Center for Integrated Manufacturing (CIM). Located on our Boulder County Campus, our state-of-the-art facility is home to our advanced manufacturing programs. Practice using next-generation manufacturing technologies so you can find a career in this growing field.

east Explore the Programs at the CIM
